msContents.summary: This bundle 35 -3078 palm leaf manuscript contains Anargharāghava play of Murāri Telugu script. Text is Complete. The Anargharāghava is a play in seven acts. Based on the story of Rāma. And and one of the most challenging pieces of classical Sanskrit poetry, written by Murāri, Maudgalya gotra, who was the son of Bhaṭṭavardhamāna and tantumathī. He would seem to belong to Orissa. Murāri himself acknowledges closely follows Rāmāyaṇa of Vālmīki with minor changes. The plot of the Anargharāghava is the story of Rāma up to his coronation. Its seven acts are named Munīndrasaṃvāda, Kaumāravikrama, Pinakabhanga, Daśarathavipralambha, Sugrīvābhiṣeka, Daśagrīvanigraha and Paṭṭābhiṣeka respectively. The play has little action — most fights and events take place behind the screen or between acts — focussing instead on diction and other elements of dramatic representation, Because of its elegant style, learned allusions and often striking imagery, The well-known epic story of Rāma’s exploits is presented as a series of political intrigues and battles, and contrasted with lyrical passages of various kinds: on love and war, pride and honor, gods and demons, rites and myths, regions and cities of ancient India.

msItem.title: Anrgharāghavam
msItem.author: Murāri
msItem.incipit: niṣpratyūhamupāsmahe bhagavataḥ kaumodakī lakṣmaṇaḥ kokaprīticakorapāraṇapaṭujyotiṣmatī locane| yābhyāmardhavibodhamugdhamadhuraśrīrardhamugdhāyito nābhīpalvalapuṇḍarīkamukulaḥ kamboḥ sapatnīkṛtaḥ| api ca| viramati mahākalpe nābhīpathaikaniketanaḥ tribhuvanapuraḥ śilpī yasya pratikṣaṇamātmabhūḥ| kimadhikaraṇā kīdṛkkasya vyavasthitirityasā- vudaramaviśaddraṣṭuṃ tasmai jagannidhaye namaḥ| nādyante sūtradhāraḥ| alamativistareṇa. bho bho lavaṇodavelāvanālītamālatarukandalasya tribhuvanamaulimaṇḍanamahānīlamaṇeḥ kamalākucakalaśakelikastūrikāpatrāṅkurasya bhagavataḥ puruṣottamasya yātrāyāmupasthānīyāḥ sabhāsadaḥ kutaściddvīpādāgatena kalahakandalanāmnā kuśīlavena raudrabībhatsabhayānakādbhutarasabhūyiṣṭhaṃ kamapi prabandhamabhinayatā nityaṃ kilāyamudvejito lekaḥ| tatkasyacidabhimatarasabhāvabhājaḥ prekṣaṇakasya prayogānujñayā nāṭyavedopādhyāyabahurūpāntevāsī madhyadeśīyaḥ sucarito nāma bharataputrohamanugṛhye. yataḥ| prītirnāma sadasyānāṃ priyā raṅgopajīvinaḥ| jitvā tadapahartārameṣa pratyāharāmi tām|
msItem.explicit: rāmaḥ| bhagavan kimataḥ paramapi priyamasti| bhagavatprasādāt| tātājñāmadhimaulimauktikamaṇiṃ kṛtvāmahāpotriṇo daṃṣṭrāvindhyavilāsapatraśabarī dṛṣṭvā bhṛśaṃ medinī| setirdakṣiṇapaścimau jalanidhī sīmantayannarpitaḥ kalpāntaṃ ca kṛtaṃ ca viśvamadaśagrīvopasargaṃ jagat| tathāpīdamastu| samunmīlatsūktastabakamakarandaiḥ śravaṇayo- raviśramyaddhārāsavanamupacinvantu kavayaḥ| na śabdabrahmotthaṃ parimalamanāghrāya ca janaḥ kavīnāṃ gambhīre vacasi guṇadoṣau racayatu| api ca| devasyātmabhuvaḥkamaṇḍalujalasrotāṃsi mandākinī- gaṅgābhogavatīmayāni punate yāvattrilokīmimām| tāvadvīrayaśo rasāyanamadhusyandaḥ kavīnāmayaṃ jāgartu śrutiśaṣkulīvalayitavyomāvagāhī guṇaḥ| iti niṣkrāntāḥ sarve|
msItem.colophon: sāmbasadāśivāya namaḥ| śrīśivā. namaḥ| sarvadhāri sahasyasya pratipadbhānuvāsare| gaṅgādharoradātprājñaḥ maurāraṃ nāṭakaṃ param| śrīrāmacandrāya namaḥ| śrīsundareśvarāya namaḥ| śrī dakṣiṇāmūrtaye namaḥ|
